author: The Editorial Board
title: Funny Business at the Trump Labor Board
text:
We wrote a couple of months ago about how Democrats in cahoots with the National Labor Relations Board Inspector General were weaponizing ethics rules to protect the Obama joint-employer standard. New evidence shows they may also have overstepped their legal authority.
The Obama NLRB in 2015 jettisoned 30 years of labor law with its Browning-Ferris ruling that held businesses responsible for workers of subcontractors if the businesses exercised indirect control over employment terms. This made it easier for unions to organize...
